unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: A Residual
question_text: A firm was conducting a study and found a linear regression model of $\hat{y}=42-6x$. Find the residual of the point $(8, 3)$.
solution:
Solution

Knowing how to calculate a residual is essential when estimating the slope of a linear regression model. Residuals are used to verify conditions for calculating a confidence interval as well as for conducting a significance test for slope.

The equation for the calculation of a residual is $y-\hat{y}$ where $y$ is the $y$ value in a given point and $\hat{y}$ is the value when the $x$ value of a given point is plugged into a given linear regression equation.

In this problem, we would first plug in $8$ to find the $\hat{y}$ value. So:
